message: The Center for Sustainable Landscapes (CSL) is an integral part of the Phipps visitor experience as a "living museum" and for focusing attention on the important intersection between the built and natural environments.
title: Welcome

widgets.title: Story Video
widgets.label: story_video
widgets.template:
Learn how the Center for Sustainable Landscapes connects people to nature in this short video.

A Living Building Takes Shape

widgets.title: Tour Video
widgets.label: tour_video
widgets.template:
Take a silent video tour of the CSL's native landscape, lagoon and atrium.

One of the Greenest Buildings in the World

message: The CSL generates almost all of its energy from solar panels. Energy is stored for the winter when there is less sunlight, and the building's efficient energy usage is minimized through passive design strategies.
title: Solar Energy

widgets.title: Solar Video
widgets.label: solar_video
widgets.template:
What are solar cells, and how do they work? Find out more about solar power - and learn how this renewable resource harnesses the power of the sun into usable energy.

A Deeper Look at Solar Power

widgets.title: Energy Cost Fun Fact
widgets.label: energy_cost_fun_fact
widgets.template:
Did you know?

The CSL uses as little as 20% of its expected energy usage (compared to traditional buildings). That's more than a $50,000 difference every year!

widgets.title: Solar Photovoltaic Overview
widgets.label: Solar_Photovoltaic_Overview
widgets.template:
Did you know?

Solar energy is the rays of sunlight that reach the Earth. This energy can be converted into electricity using photovoltaic (PV) devices or solar cells. Solar energy is found anywhere the sun shines.

widgets.title: Geothermal Overview
widgets.label: Geothermal_Overview
widgets.template:
Did you know?

A geothermal system takes advantage of the constant temperature of the Earth to heat or cool a building. No matter what the weather or temperature is like outside, ground temperatures remain at a constant 55°F all year long!

widgets.title: CO2 Saved
widgets.label: co2_saved
widgets.template:
Did you know?

The energy produced this -- saved -- lbs of CO2 released into the atmosphere. Equivalent to -- trees planted.

message: The CSL was designed and built to promote the health and well-being of the people working and learning inside. Indoor air quality is monitored and conditioned to ensure a healthy atmosphere. Also, clean air plants — species adept at removing pollutants — help occupants breathe easier.
title: Air Quality

widgets.label: outside_co2

--ppm
Outside CO2

widgets.title: Indoor CO2
widgets.label: indoor_co2

Indoor CO2

widgets.title: Air Video
widgets.label: air_video
widgets.template:
What is air pollution? Learn how greenhouse gasses, smog, and toxic pollutants effect climate change, and human health.

Air Pollution - Climate & Health

widgets.title: Health Risks
widgets.label: Health_Risks
widgets.template:
Did you know?

In Allegheny County, poor air quality poses a threat to the 25,367 children and 98,074 adults who suffer from asthma. Pollutants can shorten affected lives by months or even years.

widgets.title: Pittsburgh Air Quality Ranking
widgets.label: Pittsburgh_Air_Quality_Ranking
widgets.template:
Did you know?

The American Lung Association ranks the Pittsburgh area as the 14th most-polluted area in the country for daily fine particulate matter and the eighth most-polluted for annual particle pollution.

widgets.title: ERV
widgets.label: ERV
widgets.template:
Did you know?

Phipps' Nature lab features an Energy Recovery Ventilator (ERV), which brings a lot of fresh air into the space with very little energy input. This makes it both more efficient and quieter.

widgets.title: Outside Particulates
widgets.label: Outside_Particulates
widgets.template:
--
Outside Particulates

message: The CSL is net zero water, managing all rainfall and treating all sanitary waste on site. Up to 60,000 gallons of rainwater can be harvested and stored in a underground rain tank. It can later be used for toilet flushing, as well as interior irrigation and maintenance.
title: Water Usage

widgets.title: Water Video
widgets.label: water_video
widgets.template:
There is the same amount of water on Earth today as there was when the dinosaurs roamed. Learn more about water in all its forms and how you can make a difference.

Why Care About Water?

widgets.title: Rainwater info
widgets.label: rainwater_info
widgets.template:
Did you know?

Rainwater collected in a 325 gal cistern is filtered and treated with ultraviolet light. The water is then used to wash hands, flush toilet, and water plants.

widgets.title: Rainwater Reuse
widgets.label: Rainwater_Reuse
widgets.template:
Did you know?

24,558 gallons of rainwater have been reused or infiltrated onsite since the opening of the CSL.
